attributes.action: FORCE COMPANIES TO ALLOW STAFF AND CONSUMERS THE RIGHT TO "OPT OUT" OF THEIR DATA BEING HELD OUTSIDE THE UK
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Many companies are choosing to keep their data records of their staff and/or their customers outside of the UK, or make the records accessible from outside the UK. 
The data protection act clearly states this should only be on a voluntarily basis that data is kept, but no choice where it is kept. For example with the new NHS Electronic Staff Record Scheme, data is to be held outside of the UK, when this was challenged I was told, "Working for the NHS and getting paid are also optional".
If you buy a new TV now you have to tell the supplier your personal details but have no option where they put those details.
Consumers and Staff need far more rights over where their data is stored.
